'''Christian Charles Philip Bale''' (born 30 January 1974) is an English actor.<ref name="NotWelsh">{{cite web|url=http://www.christianbale.net/articles/2000/imdb2000.htm|quote =I was born in Wales but I'm not Welsh â I'm English!|title=Christian Bale: American Psycho|publisher=IMDB News|accessdate=2008-07-21}}</ref> In addition to starring roles in big budget [[Hollywood]] films, he has long been heavily involved in films produced by [[independent film|independent]] producers and [[art film|art houses]].
Bale first caught the public eye when he was cast in the starring role of [[Steven Spielberg]]'s ''[[Empire of the Sun (film)|Empire of the Sun]]'' at the age of 13, playing an [[English people|English]] boy who is separated from his parents and subsequently finds himself lost in a [[List of concentration and internment camps#Japanese WWII Camps in Asia|Japanese internment camp]] during [[World War II]]. Since then, he has portrayed a wide range of characters. Bale is especially noted for his [[cult figure|cult following]]: the tenth anniversary issue of ''[[Entertainment Weekly]]'' hailed him as one of the "Top 8 Most Powerful Cult Figures of the Past Decade", citing his cult status on the [[Internet]].<ref>[[Cintra Wilson|Wilson, Cintra]] (26 October 2004). [http://dir.salon.com/story/ent/feature/2004/10/26/bale/index.html?pn=1 "The magic Christian"] ''[[Salon.com|Salon]]'', retrieved on 2006-05-27.</ref> ''EW'' called Bale one of the "Most Creative People in Entertainment" in anticipation of the release ''[[American Psycho (film)|American Psycho]]'' (2000).<ref>{{cite web|title= The It List '99|url= http://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,273868_5,00.html|publisher=[[Entertainment Weekly]]|date=December 1999|accessdate=5 February 2009}} "Lately, though, he's best thought of as the anti-Leo, after winning, losing, then winning back the role of a murderous yuppie from [[Leonardo DiCaprio|DiCaprio]] in the upcoming film version of [[Bret Easton Ellis]]' ''[[American Psycho (film)|American Psycho]]''." </ref> ''[[The Guardian]]'' named Bale as one of the best actors never to have received an [[Academy Award]] nomination.<ref>{{cite news|last=Singer|first=Leigh|url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/film/filmblog/2009/feb/19/best-actors-never-nominated-for-oscars|title=Oscars: the best actors never to have been nominated|publisher=The Guardian|date=2009-02-19|accessdate=2010-02-26|location=London}}</ref>
